text: Falls Village is a village in the town of Canaan, Connecticut.Listing of Cities, Towns, Villages, and Boroughs in Connecticut, Connecticut Department of Economic and Community Development Because Falls Village is the town center in Canaan, the entire town is often called "Falls Village." In 1979 the Falls Village District was listed on the National Register of Historic Places as an historic district. The district is about that were built in the middle of the 19th century. The area was selected as a station stop for the Housatonic Railroad in the early 1830s. It includes 71 buildings. and Accompanying 20 photos, from 1978 ==References== Category:Census-designated places in Connecticut Category:National Register of Historic Places Category:19th- century establishments in Connecticut
title: Falls Village, Connecticut
